data.chText: 快步；疾走；小跑

before.enText: of a horse or its rider

data.enText: to move forward at a speed that is faster than a walk and slower than a canter

data.chText: 骑马小跑
data.enText: to ride a horse in this way

data.chText: 她骑着小马绕场慢跑。
data.enText: She trotted her pony around the field.

data.chText: 小步快跑；碎步急行

before.enText: of a person or an animal

data.enText: to run or walk fast, taking short quick steps

data.chText: 孩子们小跑着进了房间。
data.enText: The children trotted into the room.

data.chText: 步行；走；到…去
data.enText: to walk or go somewhere

data.chText: 向导在前面带路，我们跟在他的后面走。
data.enText: The guide led the way and we trotted along behind him.
be hot to trot

data.chText: 期待（某活动）
data.enText: to be very enthusiastic about starting an activity

data.chText: 欲火中烧；性欲冲动
data.enText: to be excited in a sexual way
trot sth↔out

data.chText: 重复，翻出（老一套的借口、事实、解释等）
data.enText: to give the same excuses, facts, explanations, etc. for sth that have often been used before

data.chText: 他们又用那老一套的借口解释这个地区缺少就业机会的问题。
data.enText: They trotted out the same old excuses for the lack of jobs in the area.

data.chText: （指速度）慢跑，小跑，小步快跑，疾走
data.enText: a trotting speed, taking short quick steps

data.chText: 那马放慢速度在小跑。
data.enText: The horse slowed to a trot.

data.chText: 那姑娘突然小步跑了起来，拐过街角不见了。
data.enText: The girl broke into a trot and disappeared around the corner.

data.chText: （指活动）小跑；一阵小跑
data.enText: a period of trotting
on the trot

data.chText: 接连地；接二连三；一个接着一个
data.enText: one after the other

data.chText: 他们现在已经连胜三场比赛。
data.enText: They've now won three games on the trot.

data.chText: 忙个不停
data.enText: busy all the time

data.chText: 我一整天忙得不可开交。
data.enText: I've been on the trot all day.

word_means: 慢跑，小跑，小步快跑，疾走

means: (指速度)慢跑，小跑，小步快跑，疾走

ex.chText: 那个小女孩转身跑掉了。
ex.enText: The little girl turned and ran away.

ex.chText: 学生们从教室里跑了出来。
ex.enText: The students came running out of the classroom.

ex.chText: 得知好友在大厅等着，她飞快地跑下楼梯。
ex.enText: Knowing that her best friend was waiting in the hall, she ran down the stairs as fast as she could.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，泛指各种奔跑。

ex.chText: 你每天早晨都去慢跑吗？
ex.enText: Do you go jogging every morning?

ex.chText: 她从博物馆出来，小跑着下台阶。
ex.enText: She came trotting down the steps from the museum.

ex.chText: 那对双胞胎小跑着进了自己的房间。
ex.enText: The twins trotted into their room.

synonyms.bx: 指介于跑与走之间的快速运动。

data.enText: be hot to trot

data.chText: 期待（某活动）
data.enText: to be very enthusiastic about starting an activity

data.chText: 欲火中烧；性欲冲动
data.enText: to be excited in a sexual way
on the trot

data.chText: 接连地；接二连三；一个接着一个
data.enText: one after the other

data.chText: 他们现在已经连胜三场比赛。
data.enText: They've now won three games on the trot.

data.chText: 忙个不停
data.enText: busy all the time

data.chText: 我一整天忙得不可开交。
data.enText: I've been on the trot all day.
trot sth↔out

data.chText: 重复，翻出（老一套的借口、事实、解释等）
data.enText: to give the same excuses, facts, explanations, etc. for sth that have often been used before

data.chText: 他们又用那老一套的借口解释这个地区缺少就业机会的问题。
data.enText: They trotted out the same old excuses for the lack of jobs in the area.

trans: 反复提出，反复说（陈旧的观点或过时的信息）

tr: a gait faster than a walk
diagonally opposite legs strike the ground together
a literal translation used in studying a foreign language (often used illicitly)
run at a moderately swift pace

value.def: If you trot somewhere, you move fairly fast at a speed between walking and running, taking small quick steps.

example.ex: I trotted down the steps and out to the shed...
example.tran: 我小步跑下台阶，奔向外面的小屋。

example.ex: A small shabby man was trotting beside Bardi trying to get his attention.
example.tran: 一个衣衫褴褛的矮个子男人在巴迪身边碎步急行而过，想要引起他的注意。

example.ex: He walked briskly, but without breaking into a trot.
example.tran: 他轻快地走着，但没有突然小跑起来。

value.def: When an animal such as a horse trots, it moves fairly fast, taking quick small steps. You can also say that the rider of the animal is trotting .

example.ex: Alan took the reins and the small horse started trotting...
example.tran: 艾伦抓住缰绳，小马开始慢跑起来。

example.ex: Pete got on his horse and started trotting across the field.
example.tran: 皮特跨上马，开始在田野间小跑起来。

example.ex: As they started up again, the horse broke into a brisk trot.
example.tran: 当他们又重新骑上马时，马突然轻快地小跑起来。

value.def: If something happens several times on the trot, it happens that number of times without a break.

example.ex: She lost five games on the trot...
example.tran: 她接连输了 5 场比赛。

example.ex: Sales of new cars rose in May for the second month on the trot.
example.tran: 5 月份新车的销售量连续第二个月攀升。

trans: 反复提出，反复说（陈旧的观点或过时的信息）
